Package com.ibm.vie.mazerunner

Interface IBoard

All Known Subinterfaces:
IAnalysisBoard
public interface IBoard
This interface allows the Player to inspect the board and state of the game. An IBoard does not include any methods that change the state of the game.

  • Method Summary

  • Method Details

    • getName

      String getName()
      Do not depend on the board name in your implementation. The IBM judges may:
      • Use new boards you have not seen
      • Might not use every sample board
      Returns:
      The name of the board.

    • getPlayerLocation

      Location getPlayerLocation()
      The current location of your player. In the analyze phase this corresponds to your starting position when the selectMove phase starts. This will report your new location after a move.
      Returns:
      The current location of the player.

    • getStartingLocation

      Location getStartingLocation()
      The location where the player entered the maze. This will never change for a specific board. This can be used to determine if you have backtracked (or retraced) your steps all the way back to the beginning.
      Returns:
      The location that the player started the game at

    • getTreasures

      List<Treasure> getTreasures()
      List of yet to be obtained treasures on the board.
      Returns:
      The list of treasures on the board. Boards contain at least one treasure.

    • getRemainingTreasureCount

      int getRemainingTreasureCount()
      The number of treasures remaining on the board for you to obtain.
      Returns:
      An integer of the number of treasures remaining.

    • getObtainedTreasureCount

      int getObtainedTreasureCount()
      A treasure is obtained when your player moves to a space which contains a treasure.
      Returns:
      The number of treasures on the board you have obtained.

    • getMaxSteps

      int getMaxSteps()
      Each board allows a maximum number of steps. Play of the board stops when your player exceeds this.
      Returns:
      The maximum number of steps your player may take on this board.

    • getRemainingSteps

      int getRemainingSteps()
      The number of steps your player has left on this board.
      Returns:
      An integer of the remaining steps left

    • getSquareAt

      ISquare getSquareAt(Location l)
      Get the square at the location. This object can be used to determine the type of square, as well as how many times it has been visited.
      Parameters:
      l - Location to check
      Returns:
      Square at this position

    • getWidth

      int getWidth()
      Get the width of the board, including the outer walls.
      Returns:
      An integer of the board width

    • getHeight

      int getHeight()
      Get the height of the board, including the outer walls.
      Returns:
      An integer of the board height

    • getUnexploredMoves

      List<Move> getUnexploredMoves()
      Your player might need to know if it has stepped in a certain square or has not explored a certain square from its current position. For some boards it may be necessary to move to a space more than once as paths to different treasures can overlap.
      Returns:
      The list of zero to four Move possibilities from the player's current position that have not been taken.

    • isComplete

      boolean isComplete()
      A board is complete when the player has no more steps remaining, or when all treasures have been obtained. No more moves are allowed when the board is complete.
      Returns:
      true when your player has found all of the treasure or run out of steps.

    • getScore

      int getScore()
      Get the current score for the board.
      Returns:
      An integer of the score.
